numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Some elite colleges give a legacy boost.
2. A legacy boost means the following.
3. If a parent of a student attended a college then the student has a higher chance to be admitted to the college.
4. If a sibling of a student attended a college then the student has a higher chance to be admitted to the college.
5. Wealthier students have a higher chance to be admitted to a college.
6. I wonder why a parent or a sibling who attended a college affects the admission of a student.
7. A college should focus on the student.
8. A college should not focus on other people.
11. My chance to be admitted may be lower than the chance of another person because of a family legacy.
12. My chance to be admitted may be higher than the chance of another person because of a family legacy.
13. The graph shows the effects of legacy and wealth on the chance of a person to be admitted to a college.
14. The headline is: If you have a legacy then it is your legacy to come to college.
